seriesJson.title: Hazards to education
seriesJson.description: Walgreen Lecture series on the present hazards to American education as seen and presented by Robert M. Hutchins.  Each lecture discusses one particular problem.

node.title: Social and political conformity, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts,  presents a lecture on the hazards that social and political conformity present to education.

node.title: Social and political conformity, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts,  presents a lecture on the hazards that social and political conformity present to education.

node.title: Philosophical diversity, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, focuses on the hazards that philosophical diversity poses to education.

node.title: Philosophical diversity, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, focuses on the hazards that philosophical diversity poses to education.

node.title: Specialization, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, focuses on the hazards that specialization, or the lack of a broader education,  poses to education.

node.title: Specialization, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, focuses on the hazards that specialization, or the lack of a broader education,  poses to education.

node.title: Industrialization, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, focuses on the hazards that industrialization poses to education.

node.title: Industrialization, part two
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, focuses on the hazards that industrialization poses to education.
